elements.title: Blue Mountain Pottery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Blue Mountain Pottery wares (example pictured) had a distinctive drip glaze, particularly blue-green and black, so that each piece was unique?

elements.title: Bill Morrow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Australian train driver Bill Morrow received the Soviet Union's Lenin Peace Prize alongside Fidel Castro?

elements.title: chica (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that among the Orang Asli of Negeri Sembilan, chica is only collected during kenduri rituals?

elements.title: Emi Shinohara (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sailor Moon co-stars Emi Shinohara and Rika Fukami were born on the same date?

elements.title: rechao (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that almost 45 percent of Taiwan's beer purchases come from rechao restaurants?

elements.title: Janet Panetta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Janet Panetta started dancing as physical therapy for childhood polio?

elements.title: flag of La Guaira (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the flag of La Guaira is based on the design of a banner from a 1797 conspiracy against Spanish rule in Venezuela?

elements.title: Victor Albisu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that chef Victor Albisu created a bulgogi taco that honors the Koreatown neighborhood of his hometown of Annandale, Virginia?

elements.title: the first dogs in space (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first dogs in space returned to Earth with a parachute?
